title: Moscow: current accomplishments and prospects for achieving the sustainable development goals

categories.name: Drinking Water Improvement
content: Work to improve the quality of people’s lives, which depends primarily on the availability of drinking water, is an ongoing endeavor in Moscow. Special efforts are made to prevent unpleasant odors emanating from various facilities and to reduce emissions into the atmosphere. Water quality is also a priority, with quality matching the level achieved in leading capital cities across the globe.

Water treatment facilities in Moscow use advanced technology to purify drinking water. According to the 2025 plan of the development of the Moscow water supply system, the existing water treatment facilities are undergoing refurbishment and upgrade, with the most effective technologies (above all, ozone sorption) being implemented on a step by step basis. As a water treatment method, ozone sorption is based on a combined use of ozonation and sorption processes for water purification. Depending on the operational diagram, ozonation is takes one or two stages to perform. Powdered or granulated activated carbon is used as a sorbent.

categories.name: Raising awareness of responsible water consumption

content.name: Communications facilitated via mos.ru
content: Since 2012, Moscow residents have been submitting water meter readings online through a convenient service on the Moscow Mayor’s portal, mos.ru. The service boasts a monthly audience of 1 million people. Water meters register actual water consumption, and people pay for the amount actually consumed. In order to encourage citizens to save water and draw their attention to the problem of sustainable use of natural resources, the service coverage was expanded and the following features were added to the existing service in 2021: charts and comparisons (users can see a visualized analysis of water consumption in comparison with the average figures for the city); emotional reinforcement (e.g., if water consumption goes down, the service will send a notification with a positive emoji); tips on how to reduce water consumption. In addition, the users are encouraged to take an interactive test that will help them find out how economically water is used in the house. Based on its results, tips are offered on how to avoid unnecessary water consumption.

In June 2021, a special project, Clean Water: How It Works, was launched on the mos.ru portal: mos.ru/city/projects/water. It features the most important and useful information about water, says how and why you need to save it. It describes large-scale processes of water production and treatment, and the path water takes before it reaches your faucets.
The water-saving project was acknowledged as one of the best smart city living services in the Smart Living category of the international German Innovation Award.
The goal of the project is to see a 2% reduction in water consumption by service users.

content.name: Utilization of AR technologies
content: To support the service and involve even more people in the project, an augmented reality (AR) campaign, The Price of Water, was conducted from February to April 2021. The key idea was to show how much effort and energy is actually spent on bringing water to households. In an interactive format, the users walked the entire path of a drop of water, from the moment it enters a body of water to the minute it reaches the faucet in their apartment. A special QR code was printed on the back side of the Unified Payment Document, a receipt for housing and utility services. (Twelve million papers were printed in total.) Scanning the code with a smartphone camera launched an interactive presentation with elements of augmented reality. With the help of AR, different stages of water treatment are shown, as water gets purified and becomes potable. The user is invited to “launch” the process of preparing water for supply to households, e.g., to start the purification procedure, open the pumps and taps.

categories.name: Moscow’s Investment Portal
content: To improve efficiency and quality of interaction between the capital city’s authorities and businesses, an investment portal was launched in 2014 with the backing of the Moscow Government. For ten years, it has remained one of the most popular specialized resources for businesses. More than 72,000 personal accounts have been registered on the website over time. Entrepreneurs have access to 30 online services on the investment portal. These services facilitate getting support measures sponsored by the city, reduce interaction time, help find platforms, partners and information necessary for the implementation of investment projects. In late 2020, the Moscow Investor service was launched on the investment portal. Using that service as a one-stop shop, Moscow businessmen can submit their questions and proposals regarding investment activities in the capital city and receive answers to their personal accounts within short timeframes. For the sake of convenience, a mobile application was launched in order to make services of the investment portal more readily accessible for the users. Using their smartphone, they can file an application, get information about the city’s property and select the most suitable sites, read industry-related news and check the status of their applications in the personal cabinet. Moreover, the investment portal has a section called “Industry,” which helps manufacturers find a facility where they potentially can organize their production. In addition, registered users of the portal now have access to a map of integrated development of territories, a list of the latest technological developments, as well as current industry news.
Year of service launch: 2014
More than 16.2 million have visited the portal over 10 years
Unique visitors per day: about 9,000
Total registrations on the portal: over 72,000
Online services have been used more than 500,000 times (including more than 155,000 times in 2021 and more than 55,000 times in the first six months of 2022)
The bidding system features 4,000 real estate properties owned by the city
The service for scheduling an appointment to view an object of the auction has been used more than 200,000 times
The online navigator for business support measures has been used more than 14,000 times

awards: The project was awarded the “Beneficial Practice” diploma of the review-competition of the Assembly of Capitals and Major Cities of the CIS and the EAEU “The City We Want to Live In”
The project was shortlisted for The DADI Awards in the “Finance Services” category
The project won the Digital Summit Award in the “Best Solution for Economic Development” nomination
The project received a special prize in the Russian Golden Site award in the “Business and Investment Support Site” nomination

categories.name: Project “Vision Zero”
content: In an attempt to reduce mortality from road accidents, Moscow uses the approaches of the Swedish program Vision Zero. Vision Zero is an international concept for improving road safety, which strives to reduce mortality from road accidents. It was first adopted by the Swedish Parliament in 1997. Moscow has achieved a record high level of road safety. Despite high traffic density and an increase in the number of cars, the accident rate has been declining steadily for ten years. The social risk (the number of people killed in road accidents per 100,000 people) decreased twofold compared to 2010, from 6.6 to 3. Russian President Vladimir Putin ordered that a social risk factor of no more than 4.0 should be achieved by 2024. The Moscow City Government spearheaded the initiative and reached that figure ahead of schedule.
Within the framework of the Vision Zero project, the following activities have been organized:
ongoing analysis of the accident rate;
development of measures to improve road safety;
awareness campaigns with extensive promotion of observance of traffic regulations;
design of safe road and traffic infrastructure.

In 2019, a Vision Zero task force was set up. It is active in analyzing severe accidents and developing preventive measures. The task force includes representatives of the Department of Transport and Road Infrastructure Development of the City of Moscow, Center of the Traffic Organization, Moscow’s public transport authority, traffic police, prefectures of administrative districts, Department of Housing, Utilities and Amenities, Joint Administrative and Technical Inspectorates, Motor Roads (state-funded entity), Department of Capital Repairs and Construction. Since 2010, the number of accidents in Moscow has decreased by 3.5 times.

categories.name: Supplier Portal
content: The Supplier Portal is a B2G resource that helps state customers and private entrepreneurs close online deals. Registration and participation in online transactions are free of charge.
The resource offers 3 main types of procurement:
Electronic Store. Small and medium-sized enterprises publish prices for the supplied goods, works, services, and state customers select reliable partners with the best prices or supply terms;
Mini-auction. The customer publishes a list of necessary specifications; the suppliers make bids; the winner is automatically selected by the lowest price of the last offer;
Collecting Offers. The customer publishes necessary specifications, suppliers provide their offers, and the customer chooses the winner that offers the best terms.
On the back of the procurement process, the parties exchange electronic documents, and conclude a contract using a digital electronic signature.

A catalog of goods, works and services, formed on the basis of the suppliers’ price lists, contains more than 1.7 million unique items. When a new catalog item is created, the product image is automatically analyzed and the user is recommended a category for placing new products.

Based on previous history of activities and downloaded products, artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms are used to generate a list of recommendations for suppliers with respect to planned purchases. AI is also used in the chatbot, which handles 70% of customer service calls.

content.name: Project “Land for 1 ruble”
content: A project to support large-scale investment projects in Moscow, including provision of a land plot for lease without bidding for a period of 5 years at a preferential rental rate of 1 ruble.
This allows businesses to reduce the cost of creating jobs, as well as to establish production of important products for capital city’s life and economy within a short time period.

content.name: Status “Industrial Complex”, “Industrial Park”, “Technopark”
content: Industrial complex: the status assigned to Moscow-based industrial enterprises, scientific enterprises with the status of state scientific center (allowable share of revenues generated from manufacturing production is to be at least 25%).

Industrial park: the status assigned to a complex of real estate properties under single management, if that complex consists of land plots with production, administrative, warehouse buildings and facilities, and is provided with energy resources, engineering and transport infrastructure.
Technopark: an asset of industrial and technological innovation infrastructure, which facilitates development of high-tech resident companies.
Applicants for each status are required to meet requirements for minimum revenue, investment, payroll and average monthly salary of employees.

In 2022, as part of anti-crisis measures to support businesses, Sergey Sobyanin, Mayor of Moscow, decided to automatically renew the special statuses for a period of one year, allowing companies to keep the benefits without mandatory confirmation.

categories.name: I.Moscow, Moscow Innovation Cluster Program
content: The Moscow Innovation Cluster (“Cluster”) was created in 2018 pursuant to Decree of the President of the Russian Federation No. 672 dated November 26, 2018 and Decree of the Government of Moscow No. 435-PP dated April 25, 2019.

The cluster was created to develop the innovative potential of the city of Moscow and is designed to join forces and resources of scientific and research organizations, industrial enterprises, corporations, small and medium-sized businesses, educational institutions, IT companies, engineering centers, technology parks and other companies and business people to implement joint innovative products and adopt breakthrough technologies.
Currently, the Cluster brings together more than 36,000 organizations and individual entrepreneurs from 81 regions of Russia (including 26,000 Moscow entrepreneurs).
The cluster is operated by the Moscow Innovation Cluster Foundation.

The Cluster’s services and resources are aimed at creating new technology companies, scaling projects and boosting demand for innovations, attracting investments in hi-tech projects, registering patents, including foreign ones, and creating infrastructure for development of innovations.

The IT platform i.moscow is the Cluster’s digital basis. With the help of the platform’s digital services, the Cluster’s members can, among other things, select the support measure required for their business development, apply for it, complete awareness and acceleration formalities, find a site for localization in the capital city, establish contract manufacturing of their products at independent manufacturing facilities, find technologies, and register their own solutions and developments. At i.moscow, services covering all stages of the life cycle of a project have been implemented, from the idea to scaling and entering new markets.

In particular, aspiring entrepreneurs can take part in the Academy of Innovators program. Participation in it helps launch an innovative project, and an entrepreneur can complete educational tracks, conduct pilot tests of a technological solution, and attract investors and other partners.

The Cluster’s participants interested in attracting investments for their projects can take advantage of a set of measures to support investment attraction of a project, from assistance in packaging a project adequately for investors or developing an attractive presentation of a project for investors to holding a road show with potential investors. In December 2021, Syndicate, a club of private venture investors, was set up on the basis of the Cluster to unite all those who are interested in investing in promising technological projects of the Russian capital city.

An educational program entitled Venture Academy was launched for aspiring investors in 2021. Training is free, and it is provided on a competitive basis. As part of the educational activities, course attendees receive information on how to increase their initial investment capital, close a profitable financial deal, open an investment fund, find partners to establish a syndicate, determine which venture capital trends will be in the forefront in the coming years, and how to reduce investment risks.

For those who carry out activities in research and development, the Patent Exchange was launched in 2022. This service allows them to efficiently organize work with the results of intellectual activity. As of today, more than 1.7 million patents are featured on the service page. In addition, the service “Search for patents for inventions and utility models,” as well as “Search for trademarks” was launched. In addition, the Cluster’s participants can get grants for patenting inventions and/or utility models abroad and in the Russian Federation (up to 2 million rubles and 75,000 rubles, respectively).

As part of the Cluster, infrastructure has been created to promote cooperation between the academic community and businesses. In January 2023, the cluster Lomonosov, with a total area of 65,000 square meters was opened at Sparrow Hills, Moscow State University’s innovation science and technology center. The facility has on its grounds companies carrying out scientific and technological activities and provides an environment for the development of breakthrough innovative products through tax benefits and other preferences offered to the center’s residents. Resident companies receive tax exemption for the first 10 years of operations (incl. exemption from income tax, property tax and value-added tax); they are eligible for a refund of customs duties, and will not need to obtain a permit for educational activities; insurance premiums will be reduced to 14%. Twenty-six companies have already received the status of a Lomonosov cluster resident.
Year of project launch: 2019
More than 35,000 participants and partners are registered in the Moscow Innovation Cluster
Cluster members represent 81 regions of Russia
12 cross-industry clusters have been created as part of the project
More than 200 support measures are available to the members of the cluster
Over 550 manufacturers have been registered on the contract manufacturing exchange

awards: The project won the Runet Prize in the “Economy and Business” category
The platform took second place in the Russian national competition of regional and municipal informatization projects PROF-IT.2020, in the Support for Business category.
The project received a special prize in the Russian “Golden Site” award in the in the “Best Usability / UX” nomination

categories.name: Program for the creation of workplaces
content: The city launched a workplace program in 2020. It is designed to boost comprehensive development of residential areas, taking into account the need for jobs, to reduce commuting to the city center, and to diminish the burden on roads and public transportation.

In turn, the city gives investors an opportunity to make significant savings and increase their income in the future. For the creation of additional jobs, developers receive from the city a benefit on payment for changing the type of permitted use of land for the construction of a residential building. As a result, the investor will be receiving income not only from the sale of apartments, but also from the construction of a new commercial facility.

By now, the city has entered into 33 agreements with developers. Under these agreements, the developers will build 76 properties which will employ more than 56,600 people. A record number of agreements were signed in 2022. There were 17 of them, which is almost twice as many as in previous years.

Under all the signed agreements, investors will build 47 educational institutions, 10 office centers, nine modern industrial complexes, four retail-and-office buildings and shopping malls, as well as a sports facility and an art museum.

The implementation of the projects will require an investment of 152 billion rubles, and upon commissioning of the facilities, more than 56,600 new jobs will be created in the city. Most of the new workplaces, or over 40,400, will be located in office premises and commercial buildings.

The peak of investment activity occurred in late November and early December 2022. In that period, the city signed nine agreements with developers on creation of workplaces. Investors will build 16 educational institutions, an innovation center, an art museum, two industrial complexes, and three office buildings. These facilities will generate more than 19,700 jobs for the city.

This type of cooperation is beneficial for both the city and the investor: The program not only addresses employment issues but also reduces commuting and the burden on the roads, with the investors getting an opportunity to make significant savings and increase their income in the future.

The workplace program is popular with developers. Some of the investors who previously entered into agreements with Moscow continue to come up with new projects and also bring existing ones to the next level by expanding their facilities and/or investing additional funds in creating new workplaces.

The terms of the program are improved on an ongoing basis and broadened depending on the needs of the developers and the current economic situation. This year, an opportunity emerged to increase the scope of benefits. For this purpose, it is necessary to reduce the period of workplace creation. If that period is cut by 6 to 12 months, the benefit will increase by 5%, and with a reduction of 12 months upwards, it will increase by 10%.
Also in 2022, we expanded the list of facilities that make investors eligible for a benefit. Facilities providing complex logistics services have been added to the list.

In addition, from this year onward, developers may involve more co-contractors in their projects. Previously, the investor and the involved party’s memberships were to have at least a 75-percent match; now the requirement has been reduced to 51 percent.

Another novelty: an increase in the time limit for the creation of jobs inside a residential buildings. Previously, it was from three to six years, depending on the size of the building, and now the contract will remain valid until the completion of construction of an apartment building.

Changes have also affected the factors that affect the calculation of the scope of benefits. For all districts of the Russian capital city, a single factor was introduced, which determines the scope of benefit for cultural facilities, social infrastructure and inpatient medical facilities. For schools, children daycare centers and outpatient clinics that factor will apply if workplaces are created on the same grounds with a residential compound.

Developers from Pioneer Group, FSK, Afi Development, Capital Group, RG-Development, Strana Development, 3S Group, Sber, Samolet, Granel and Level Group have already joined the program. Some of them have signed not one but several agreements, e.g., Pioneer Group, FSK, Capital Group and some others.

categories.name: Moscow’s Digital Twin
content: The Digital Twin of Moscow is a city management tool based on a 2,500-square km 3D model of the capital city, which integrates street panoramas, models, information about buildings and facilities, up-to-date spatial information, geoanalytics tools and other data, which comprise more than 5,000 information layers.

The Digital Twin helps take a comprehensive approach to the development of infrastructure and city improvement, taking into account all parameters and development scenarios. For example, users can change parameters of the model online, including the location of the designed infrastructure facilities, the characteristics of landscaping elements, evaluate everything and pick the best development scenario.

The Digital Twin is in high demand in urban planning and city development—for example, in citywide and territorial planning and development (with legal restrictions taken into account). For instance, ahead of the construction of a new residential complex, experts can visually assess the future architectural appearance of the area, simulate all stages of the future construction (from design documentation to landscaping of the courtyard area), assess the impact of the new facility on the load of public transport, schools, and hospitals. Modeling of road infrastructure with the Digital Twin facilitates optimization of traffic flows in the city.

awards: The Digital Twin of Moscow received the ISOCARP Award for Excellence
The project became the winner of the TAdviser IT-PRIZE in information technology in the “Digital Twin of the Year” nomination
The Digital Twin of Moscow became one of the winners of the IX all-Russian competition of regional and municipal informatization projects PROF-IT.2021 in the ‘Best Innovative Project’ nomination
The project received a prize of the Digital Summit Award 2021 in the ‘Best IT Solution for Smart City’ nomination

categories.name: Pilot testing of innovative solutions
content: Pilot testing of innovative solutions in Moscow is carried out in accordance with Decree No. 631-PP of the Moscow Government, dated May 27, 2020, “On Pilot Testing of Innovative Solutions in the City of Moscow.”
Prerequisites:
Overcoming barriers to bringing new products to market;
Receiving feedback from potential users by developers;
Customizing innovative solutions, catering to the needs of the customer.
Target audience:
Russian and international technology companies offering innovations for the city;
State-owned and commercial organizations, recognized leaders in the implementation of innovations in their industries.
Objectives:
Promoting innovation in the urban environment;
Verifying technological and economic efficiency of introducing innovations.
About 250 pilot tests have been completed. 100 grant applications already approved.
As of early 2023, more than 200 pilot testing sites are enrolled in the program.

categories.name: Electronic prescriptions
content: Electronic prescriptions with a QR code have been prescribed in all city polyclinics since February 2021. Muscovites can get prescription medications by presenting a QR code on the mobile screen. This option is available in all pharmacies of the Department of Health – more than 2.5 thousand pharmacies and pharmacy points participate in the project. Moscow doctors have written out over 35 million electronic prescriptions with a QR code.

In January 2022, a pilot project was launched in Moscow, within the framework of which citizens can now receive preferential medicines not only in pharmacies of the Moscow Department of Health, but also in commercial pharmacies using electronic prescriptions. It is important that, if desired, the patient will be able to pay extra and take another trade name. Over 350 commercial pharmacies have joined the project.

categories.name: Artificial intelligence in radiation diagnostics
content: Computer vision and artificial intelligence help doctors analyze medical images of patients. Algorithms mark areas of possible pathologies with color hints and rank medical images according to the degree of probability of pathology. In any case, the final diagnosis is made by a doctor, but the use of new technologies significantly speeds up the diagnosis and increases its accuracy.

Neural networks have already processed more than 8.5 million radiation studies of patients. Doctors use 44 computer vision services in 19 areas of radiation research. Their capabilities are regularly expanded and the share of images that are processed by smart algorithms is constantly growing. As of today, half of all radiation examinations of patients in Moscow polyclinics are analyzed by artificial intelligence services

The algorithms are available to radiologists of 150 medical institutions, including children's. By the end of 2023, there will be another 20 new clinical areas in which developers will be able to offer their algorithms for the capital's healthcare, and by the end of this year there will be about 50 of them.
Moscow radiologists have developed 10 Russian state standards for testing artificial intelligence.

categories.name: Electronic medical card
content: Electronic medical record (EMC) is a universal repository of information about the patient's health. In the electronic medical record on mos.ru and in the EMIAS mobile app.INFO reflects the results of admission from specialists. Both the patient and the doctor have access to the results of their analyses and studies around the clock. The amount of information available in the EMC is gradually expanding.

As of today, 17 million active cards have been issued. In total, the EMC contains more than 2.2 billion structured data. The introduction of the EMC made it possible to convert many other medical documents into an electronic format — an electronic prescription, an electronic hospital certificate and others. This is a huge saving of polyclinic resources and time of doctors and patients.

Patients can make an appointment with a doctor, as well as reschedule and cancel an appointment, view directions, view prescriptions remotely without a visit to the clinic at any convenient time and in any place. Most often, citizens use the mobile application "EMIAS. INFO". In addition, the service is available in the applications "Public Services of Moscow" and "My Moscow", on the portals mos.ru and "EMIAS. INFO". To make an online appointment with a doctor, you need a Moscow compulsory medical insurance policy, as well as an attachment to one of the polyclinics of the capital. In 2022, Muscovites signed up online for a doctor more than 100 million times.

Before a doctor's appointment, an artificial intelligence-based chatbot collects patients' complaints about their well-being. This is a service of a single digital healthcare platform that allows you to reduce the time spent by doctors on collecting complaints and anamnesis. The chatbot is integrated with EMIAS, and is available to residents of Moscow when making an appointment with a therapist, an otorhinolaryngologist, a gynecologist, an ophthalmologist, a surgeon, as well as parents of children under 18 years of age – before an appointment with a pediatrician. Over the entire period of operation, Muscovites have used the chatbot more than 1.6 million times. In addition, the digital assistant helps Muscovites to enter personal history information into the EMC.

Thanks to the EMC in Moscow, it becomes possible to organize a paperless format of the polyclinic. All children's polyclinics of the city have already completely abandoned paper medical cards. This freed both doctors and parents of young patients from unnecessary paperwork. Paper medical records began to be transported for storage to the Glavarchiv's robotic cluster. Comfortable rooms for doctors — professional growth rooms and rest rooms - are being equipped in polyclinics on the site of former card storage facilities. Doctors will be able to gather for trainings and master classes, discuss scientific projects, work tasks.

categories.name: Medical Decision Support system
content: At the appointment, the doctor is assisted by a medical decision support system — a digital service based on artificial intelligence integrated into the Unified Medical Information and Analytical System of Moscow (EMIAS). The doctor enters the patient's complaints into the examination protocol, which the digital assistant immediately begins to analyze and then suggests the three most likely preliminary diagnoses. At the same time, a specialist can either choose one of the proposed diagnoses or make his own. The final decision is always left to the specialist.

After the preliminary diagnosis is determined, the system generates a list of studies and additional consultations. The doctor can either agree with it, or supplement or shorten it. Thanks to this, the doctor spends about 10 times less time on appointments.
More than 9 million preliminary diagnoses were made in Moscow with the help of artificial intelligence.

content.name: Digital super-service “Moving under the Renovation Program”
content: The “Moving under the Renovation Program” super-service is an information resource for participants in the program, which involves construction of new comfortable houses to replace obsolete housing and resettlement of former residents. The service helps people who move into a new house at different stages of moving to a new apartment.

Detailed instructions have been prepared to help tenants get ready for moving to a new apartment, including general instructions (providing information about the documents necessary for relocation and the actions that need to be taken to buy additional living space) and instructions for special cases.
All participants of the renovation program, who are currently moving to a new apartment, have access to an interactive personal instruction and six free electronic online services:
hiring movers;
scheduling an appointment for a lookover of the proposed apartment;
filing an application for elimination of construction defects after inspecting the apartment;
scheduling an appointment with a notary;
pre-registration for concluding an agreement for an apartment;
online downloading of required documents.
The service page also provides links to other city online services and contacts of institutions that may be needed when relocating.

Super service users are informed about the stages of relocation in their personal account on mos.ru, by email or by push notifications in the city’s mobile applications. In particular, using those messages, the service notifies users about the start of relocation, offers a visit to the new apartment, suggests signing a statement of consent or refusal, asks residents to sign an agreement, notifies them of elimination of construction defects in the new apartment (if such defects were identified during the lookover) and invites them to a second viewing.
The super service page has been visited by 350,000+ unique users, both current participants of the program and city dwellers interested in the stages of resettlement.
Since the information service was launched, participants of the renovation program have received over 400,000 electronic notifications on the stages of resettlement.

content.name: Moscow Housing Renovation Program
content: The renovation program was launched by the Moscow government on August 1, 2017. Thanks to this initiative, more than 1 million Muscovites will move from dilapidated five-story buildings into high-quality modern houses. Program participants receive equivalent housing in their neighborhood. New apartments are provided with improved finish.

The renovation program includes houses built between 1957 and 1968 according to standard projects of the first period of industrial house-building, as well as houses with similar construction features.
By now, a considerable part of those houses has reached a high degree of obsolescence and deterioration, and their design features do not allow for major repairs.

Based on the results of a survey of the bearing and non-bearing elements, engineering systems and equipment, it was found that the technical condition of the houses is characterized by a decrease in the bearing capacity and operational characteristics of the building structures. No repair works would bring about qualitative technical changes and improvement of living conditions with observance of safety measures. In case of further operation, those houses would fall into an unacceptable condition in the next 10 to 15 years and would become unlivable.

The renovation program adopted for the period until 2032 is designed to renovate the housing stock and to prevent mass build-up of unfit housing in the capital city. It will enable qualitative improvement of the urban environment. Comfortable and well-appointed neighborhoods would appear, and availability of infrastructure would increase through rational and efficient planning of the territories. These activities would contribute to the formation of a modern architectural look of the capital city.
The approved program includes 5,175 residential buildings, or more than 350,000 apartments with a total area of 16.4 million square meters, and affects lives of about 1 million people.

content.name: Bicycles and scooters
content: Bicycles:

Velobike is a city service for renting bikes in Moscow. The goal of the project is to create an alternative to cars and public transport and offer city residents and tourists an affordable means of transport for short trips and multimodal movement using various means of public transport.
In 2022, there were 765 bicycle rental stations in Moscow, more than 7,200 bicycles are available for rent, 895 of which are electric ones
Scooters:

The service for short-term rental of e-scooters in Moscow is represented by five companies: Whoosh, Urent, Yandex Go, Lite, EcoWay. To rent a scooter, users need to register in the operator’s app or in the Moscow Transport app.

Special “slow zones” were created to improve road safety in the city. These are zones in the busiest areas and parks, where the speed of e-scooters is automatically reduced to 5-15 km/h. In total, there are 189 slow zones in the city, 49 of them are located in residential areas.

content.name: Carsharing
content: Carsharing (a short-term rental service with per-minute charges) services in Moscow are provided by Delimobil, Citydrive, BelkaCar, Yandex.Drive. To rent a car, users need to register in the mobile app of an operator. For registration, drivers need to attach photos of their passport and driving license, and then sign an agreement. The verification process may take a few days.

When the rental period is over, the driver can leave the car within the perimeter of the Moscow Ring Road, in several designated areas outside of the Moscow Ring Road, and at airports. The user of the carsharing service does not pay for parking in paid parking areas.

To increase safety of carsharing services, many operators have introduced evaluation of the driving style, which is used to build the driver’s rating, and an more stringent identification system during registration and at the start of the rental period. The implementation of telematics, introduced fines and restriction of access for dangerous driving help reduce the number of accidents involving carsharing vehicles. Today, accidents with those vehicles occur less frequently than accidents involving private cars.

content.name: Million Trees campaign
content: The Million Trees campaign is the city’s most ambitious landscaping program, which began in 2013. The goal is to decorate yards of residential buildings and territories of municipal institutions with greenery.

Muscovites vote on the Active Citizen project website. Then lists of courtyards with the highest number of votes are formed. Specialists go see the yards and approve the lists. Residents of the capital city select varieties of trees and shrubs to be planted. You can choose between fir tree, willow, oak, birch, maple, rowan tree, bird cherry, linden, apple tree, mulberry, ash tree, larch, lilac, mock-orange, hawthorn, barberry, spirea, rosehip, cranberry, dogwood, silverweeds, ninebark, snowberry.
More than four million trees and shrubs have already been planted.

The Million Trees campaign applies not only to the yards of residential buildings, but also to the grounds of schools, child daycare centers, clinics, hospitals, rehabilitation centers, orphanages and other social institutions in the city. In 2021, 2,284 trees and 44,136 shrubs were planted on the grounds of 200 social facilities.

content.name: Our Tree project
content: Our Tree is an online service for participants of the citywide project of free tree planting in Moscow parks in honor of the birth of children. The project is focused on the preservation of family values and improvement of the environmental situation.
Users pick a park on an interactive map, a place in it and a tree species, and city services plant a large plant (10-15 years old saplings several meters in height are used).

Applications are submitted electronically at mos.ru. It takes about seven days to finalize the decision, which is submitted to the user’s personal account on the portal. The service can be used by people whose children were born in 2019 or later, provided that at least one parent is registered in Moscow. Applications can be submitted within three years from the child’s birthdate.

The tree planting takes place in a special ceremony, in the applicant’s presence. Ten days ahead of the event, the applicant receives notification with the exact date, time and future location of the family tree to be planted, and another reminder three days before the ceremony. The trees are planted by professionals using special equipment, but applicants can participate in the final work. e.g., leveling of the tree, making a hole and embedment of the plant.

categories.name: Citizens’ involvement in the city’s development

content.name: My Moscow app
content: My Moscow is the official mobile application of the portal of the Mayor and Government of Moscow, mos.ru. Users can use iOS or Android-based mobile devices (smartphones or tablets) to obtain the most popular services of the city. The app is available in AppStore, Google Play, RuStore and Huawei AppGallery.

The application’s services cover healthcare, utilities, charity, education and other sectors. In particular, residents can use the app to schedule an appointment with a doctor, submit water and electricity meter readings, pay utility bills, help charity organizations, check school schedules, attendance and grades of a child and find out city news.

For example, the service for paying utility bills allows users to save time in comparison with the traditional approach, i.e. receiving bills by mail, filling it out manually and paying at a bank branch. Users receive notifications about new bills in their mobile app and can pay several bills at a time. Moreover, users have access to the entire history of their payments and can download, save or send their payment receipts using instant messengers or email.

In December 2020, a voice assistant was launched in the app. It answers users’ questions: in response to an oral inquiry the bot will display necessary information or open a window to get the service. The bot can find a school schedule, submit water meter readings, display utility bills or a planned hot water shutdown schedule, and answer informal questions.
Launch date: 2019
Since the launch of the app, over 3.7 million people have installed it
Active audience of the app: 900,000 people per month

awards: The project got a silver prize at the WeGO 2020 Awards in the “Efficient Government” category
The project received the “Beneficial Practice” diploma of the review competition “The City We Want to Live In” of the Assembly of Capitals and Large Cities of the CIS and EAEU
The application was shortlisted for The DADI Awards in the “Public Sector and Public Initiatives” nomination
The project won a prize of the Russian competition “Golden App” in the “Coronavirus” category (projects, sites that were useful during the pandemic)

content.name: Active Citizen service
content: Active Citizen is a platform to organize polls on urban development issues and allow residents to evaluate the implementation of the decisions they have made. With the help of this tool, residents can express their opinion and influence the improvement of territories, the work of public organizations (outpatient clinics, libraries, multifunctional centers), the format of festivals, and also learn about new things introduced in the city.

Since its launch, the project has significantly expanded its functionality. Currently, Active Citizen combines several services, including public discussions, Electronic House and the Million Prizes campaign. The following sections are available on the website and in the app of the project: Polls, Results, Endorsement Store, City News, Project in Faces. The decisions that were implemented on the back of votes are presented on an online map.

Neural network algorithms are used to classify requests to technical support and to organize search for a suitable answer from the knowledge base, and also for behavioral analysis of users in order to identify users violating good faith principles and prevent voting frauds.

Among all IT projects of the Government of Moscow, Active Citizen was the first to switch to blockchain in 2017. The technology allows anyone to track voting results in real time. Blockchain also helps ascertain the uniqueness of voters.
Launch date: May 2014
More than 6 million users have joined the Active Citizen project
An average of 200,000 people take part in citywide polls
More than 5,400 thousand polls were conducted and over 3,600 decisions were implemented over the 8 years of the project work
More than 191 million opinions of citizens were collected during online voting

awards: The Active Citizen project was selected by the organizers of the Smart City Week in the U.S. as an example of best practices in the field of involving residents in city governance
The project became the finalist of the World Smart Sustainable Cities Organization’s WeGO Award
The Active Citizen project received the “Beneficial Practice” diploma of the review-competition of the Assembly of Capitals and Major Cities of the EAEU “The City We Want to Live In”
The project ranked third in the Russian nationwide competition of regional and municipal informatization projects PROFIT.2020, in the “Interactive Communication with Citizens” nomination
The Active Citizen project received a special prize in the “Best Application Usability/UX” nomination of the Golden Application 2021 award

content.name: Electronic House service
content: Electronic House is an online platform for the communication of residents and management companies in apartment houses. It is available in the Electronic House Moscow app that can be downloaded from App Store or Google Play.
With the help of the platform, residents can, in particular:
conduct polls and hold general meetings of owners online;
submit applications and call repair specialist to fix problems in the apartment, house and yard (for houses connected to the Unified Dispatch Center);
submit meter readings and pay utility bills (for houses connected to the Unified Information and Payment Center);
chat with neighbors;
use a common electronic bulletin board;
read the news about the house and the region.
On the map of connected houses users can find their address, learn about ongoing surveys and general meetings of owners, and, having completed authorization, view a list of registered neighbors.

content.name: Our City portal
content: Our City is a portal helping residents report problems related to housing and communal services and landscaping, e.g., uncleared snow, overflowing garbage bins, potholes on the roads, etc. The portal’s launch in 2011 helped the city authorities get signals about arising issues and address them faster.

Moscow Residents can report more than 200 types of issues across various sections, such as My Yard, My House, My Road, My Park, Public Institutions, Public Transport, Commerce and Advertising, Urban Territory.

The editorial staff of the portal processes messages, accepts the request or rejects it due to external reasons. With the help of a built-in classifier of problematic issues, an accepted application is automatically sent to the authority or organization responsible for eliminating a specific problem. The authorities prepare the answer within 8 working days, and after moderation it is sent to the relevant user.

Residents can control elimination of the issue themselves. If the problem is not properly resolved, the resident who reported it can claim that the problem has not been fixed. The portal preserves anonymity of residents by using pseudonyms, so that all requests can be considered in an unbiased manner.

In addition to sending messages, the Our City portal can be used to assess the quality of services in the multifunctional center, medical appointments and other city services, receive information about the schedule of major repairs in the house and contractors who perform them, scheduled shutdowns of hot water, etc.
Launch date: 2011
More than 1.8 million users have registered on the portal since 2011
More than 6 million issues have been resolved
Requests on more than 200 topics are accepted via the service
More than 3,000 messages from residents are received every day
50% of problems are solved within one or two days

awards: The project became a prize winner of the World Smart City Awards in the “City as a Service Platform” nomination
The portal was the winner of the Guangzhou International Award for Urban Innovation in the “Public Participation in Key Decision Making” nomination
The project was awarded a ‘Beneficial Practice’ diploma of the review-competition of the Assembly of Capitals and Major Cities of the EAEU “The City We Want to Live In”

content.name: My District project
content: The goal of the My Neighborhood project is to create comfortable living conditions and ensure systemic development of infrastructure in every district of Moscow. The project brings together within a single system all city projects related to gentrification, high-quality education, healthcare, work, and leisure for Muscovites. The My District program provides residents with access to information on the development of their district, allows them to take part in the improvement of urban infrastructure and beautification of urban territories. The project implementation helps create a single standard of living and urban environment throughout the city, so that every district has a high-level healthcare system, good schools, useful libraries, interesting and popular sports groups and clubs in recreation centers, as well as parks, squares, and workout grounds. The project is underway in 12 administrative districts of Moscow, and includes 146 districts and inhabited localities of the city.

content.name: Public Discussions service
content: Public Discussions is a service where residents can learn about city planning projects, ask questions and receive advice from project developers, come up with suggestions and comments. Public discussions in electronic form are conducted on the Active Citizen project website by Moscow’s Urban Planning and Land Commission and represent a legally regulated alternative to public hearings. In the online format, the same issues are considered that were previously deliberated only offline. Generally, they concern construction and changes in the layout of urban spaces.

Thanks to the Public Discussions service, residents can familiarize themselves with urban planning projects and leave their suggestions and comments online. Prior to the launch of the service, residents had to come in person to the place of public hearings in order to view urban planning designs and make their suggestions. The electronic format made public hearings accessible to everyone, including people with mobility issues who found it difficult to attend events in person. Project materials are accessible both from a personal computer or a mobile device. Participants in public discussions can provide their feedback, ask questions and receive answers from the organizer of a public discussion. Access to discussions is not limited to working hours or weekends. This approach to the organization of the procedure ensures maximum coverage of all interested citizens.

content.name: City of Ideas platform
content: The City of Ideas platform is a tool of two-way communication between citizens and city authorities, which helps obtain feedback, including suggestions on key development issues of the megalopolis.

Users who have an account on mos.ru can offer ideas in the areas of culture, landscaping, transport, parks, commuting about the city, bicycles and scooters, railway infrastructure, social sphere and electronic projects. Some projects were related to the development of Moscow’s healthcare system, education, and the city’s environmental strategy. Electronic projects became the most popular section.

All ideas and proposals from Moscow residents that have been accepted after moderation are selected by industry experts and put up for a vote by participants of the crowdsourcing project. The most popular ideas are then implemented by the city.
Since 2020, residents of Moscow have been using the option of confirming the implementation of the proposed ideas. Residents can upload photos of the ideas implemented in the city.
Launch date: 2014
More than 360,000 participants have registered on the platform

About 40 projects have been implemented, and more than 113,000 ideas have been proposed. The implementation of 4,700 of these ideas has already started, and more than 3,000 have already been implemented
In 2021 alone, more than 63,000 users registered on the platform and about 500 ideas were implemented

awards: The project was shortlisted for The DADI Awards in the “Best Tech Platform” nomination

categories.name: mos.ru
content: The official website of the Mayor and Government of Moscow, mos.ru, is a digital platform that features the city’s services, current news and announcements of events, detailed instructions for getting public services, information about the work and composition of the city’s authorities, and options for sending an official appeal or request to them. The website is available from a computer, smartphone or a tablet.

With the help of the portal, users can receive services 24/7 online without visiting various departments offline, collecting paper certificates and documents. For example, using mos.ru, residents can pay utility bills and car fines, schedule an appointment with a doctor, find out the child’s grades and what the child ate for lunch, apply for subsidies and other social benefits.

The service provision status is displayed in the user’s personal account. Users can save information about their documents, cars, address and family members in their personal account in order not to enter this information once again to get the services on the portal.

The portal is also a platform for promoting government initiatives to implement UN goals: reducing water consumption, sorting waste, helping disadvantaged people, and others. The ability to obtain services online makes the city more inclusive.
Year of launch: 2015
Residents and businesses can get more than 380 services online
More than 50 million users visit mos.ru every month
15 million people have registered personal accounts

awards: The portal became the best project in the “State and Society” category of the Runet Prize
Moscow ranked first in the UN’s electronic services provision index
The portal was the winner in the “State and Society” category of the Runet Prize
Moscow’s complex of digital solutions for combating the pandemic received the Runet Award in the “Technology vs Coronavirus” category (the award entry included the mos.ru portal)
The project was awarded the “Beneficial Practice” diploma of the review-competition of the Assembly of Capitals and Major Cities of the EAEU “The City We Want to Live In”
The portal was shortlisted for The DADI Awards in the “Public Sector and Public Initiatives” category
Mos.ru won a special prize at the Golden Site competition in the “Government Project Website” nomination
The project was shortlisted for the Smart Cities Council Readiness Challenge

categories.name: Ecological education
content: Environmental education in the interests of sustainable development in the city of Moscow is implemented in the following forms: additional general development programs of natural science orientation, including the use of distance learning (the project "Eco-school online", "Ecolectory", etc.); extracurricular activities; mass environmental events, promotions, contests, festivals for students; environmental expeditions, profile shifts during the vacation period.

The list of city events of the Department of Education and Science of the City of Moscow annually includes competitive events on environmental education (within the framework of the Moscow City Ecological Festival "Nature of Russia"). The main activities within which the problems of sustainable development are revealed are:

Olympiad "Nature of Russia" (held in the format of an individual championship on knowledge of natural and biological diversity, environmental problems and peculiarities of regions, environmental protection);

Moscow Ecological Forum of Students (held in the format of competitive readings on the conducted research and completed socially significant projects in the field of biological diversity and environmental issues of the country);

City quest in natural sciences (held in the format of a team championship of students of educational organizations, which is a movement along the route and the performance of various tasks on the topic "interaction of nature and society in Moscow and Russia");

"Green Olympiad" of young ecologists and naturalists (held in the format of a team championship in a natural area for practical knowledge of the biological diversity of the Moscow region, methods of field work of biologists and ecologists).

The Olympiad events are held within the framework of interdepartmental cooperation with the institutions of the Department of Nature Management and Environmental Protection of the City of Moscow. At least 25 thousand students take part in the events of the Olympiad.

More than 1,600 schoolchildren took part in educational excursion programs in the State Educational Educational Institution of the ICT Center on the basis of the Museum of Nature, the Museum of Natural History, the greenhouse and the mini zoo.

To implement the goal "Partnership for Sustainable Development" (Goal No. 17), educational organizations cooperate with specially protected natural areas of the city to conduct field ecological excursions and workshops. At least 700 people become their participants annually.

The project "Green Schools of Moscow" is actively developing in the education system, aimed at creating an environmentally oriented educational environment and developing the ecological culture of schoolchildren. Within five years, about 300 educational organizations have been included in the project.

Since 2017, the project "Eco saturdays" has been implemented as part of the Moscow Schoolboy Saturdays. The project provides ample opportunities for schoolchildren and students of the city to get acquainted with the basic environmental principles, approaches and strategies of modernity.

categories.name: Environmental monitoring
content: The MosEcoMonitoring portal is an open official source of information on the air condition for both professionals (environmental experts, NGOs and rating services) and the general public. The data on the portal is updated every hour and is collected from 56 automatic air pollution control stations located in Moscow. The resource collects information on 16 analyzed pollutants. Short reports and data visualized in the form of an interactive map are also available on the portal.

In addition, the website publishes (in real time) meteorological data from the Ostankino TV tower (wind speed, atmospheric pressure, humidity, visibility range, air temperature) and information about weather conditions that prevent the diffusion of pollutants. This information is collected from special devices that measure atmospheric radiation and determine the air temperature at different heights. The portal also has a section providing information about the condition of green spaces in Moscow.
Users can participate in a survey and share their opinion about air quality in Moscow.
Launch date: 2018
Average number of visits to the mosecom.mos.ru website is 8,000 per month

The number of visits grows every year: in 2018, the number of visits exceeded 135,000, in 2019, it went over 151,000, in 2020, it was more than 198,000, in 2021, over 225,000, in the first half of 2022 the number of visits to the site surpassed 101,000

awards: The project was shortlisted for The DADI Awards in the “Not-for-Profit/Charity” nomination
The project was shortlisted for the Smart Cities Council Readiness Challenge

categories.name: E-platforms to engage city dwellers in Moscow development

Since the launch of the app, over 3.7 million people have installed it
Active audience of the app: 900,000 people per month

The project received the “Beneficial Practice” diploma of the review competition “The City We Want to Live In” of the Assembly of Capitals and Large Cities of the CIS and EAEU
The application was shortlisted for The DADI Awards in the “Public Sector and Public Initiatives” nomination
The project won a prize of the Russian competition “Golden App” in the “Coronavirus” category (projects, sites that were useful during the pandemic)

In 2021 alone, more than 63,000 users registered on the platform and about 500 ideas were implemented

awards: The project was shortlisted for The DADI Awards in the “Best Tech Platform” nomination

categories.name: City of Discoveries project
content: City of Discoveries, an innovative educational and tourist project, is compliant with the generally recognized concept of education in the interests of sustainable development as a product of extended education for schoolchildren and an effective tool for career guidance. The project is aimed at raising awareness and fostering competences of schoolchildren and youth from Russian provinces. Enrollees study the city in an interactive format. The project is unique in that it changes the role model of those who cover tourist routes: from simple observers they transform into researchers with proactive behavior. The project promotes students’ decision-making skills, enabling them to make informed decisions for the sake of preservation of the environment, economic vitality of society in the interests of the present and future generations. More than 2,500 schoolchildren from 45 regions of Russia, Israel, China and other countries took part in the project's online and offline interactive educational and tourist program. The City of Discoveries project was evaluated by experts of the Russian Academy of Education and praised by them as an innovative program of extended education for children.

Educational and tourist routes of the project include visits to high-tech enterprises, innovative start-ups, and research laboratories. The project maintains a constant interest in learning and relevant communities. Participants have a unique opportunity to present and implement their own business startup ideas, aimed at creating a favorable urban environment, implementation of innovations in major sectors of the economy.

categories.name: Citywide Wi-Fi network
content: The Moscow City Wi-Fi network (Moscow_WiFi_Free) has more than 21,500 access points and allows residents to connect to Wi-Fi for free on central streets, in some parks, cultural and sports facilities and in university dormitories.
The City Wi-Fi network currently includes:
more than 3,600 access points on the streets inside the Garden Ring Road and inside the Third Transport Ring;
1,000+ access points in 56 city parks;
more than 14,900 access points in 177 university dormitories;
over 1,700 access points in 312 cultural and sports facilities;
92 access points at 11 transport hubs and bus stations.

All access points of the City Wi-Fi are combined into a seamless network: users do not have to reconnect to Wi-Fi every time when they move from one access point to another. It is enough to get authorized once and then undergo mandatory identification by phone number or using Mos.ID (an account on the mos.ru portal) once every three months (according to legal requirements).

categories.name: Moscow Urbanistic Forum
content: Moscow Urbanistic Forum (MUF) is an annual international conference in the area of urban policy, architecture, strategic urban development. It was first held in 2011.

The MUF is an important platform and source of expertise on sustainable urban development. In 2014, a publishing program was launched—to release studies for the forum and a periodical, Urban Agenda. In 2019, a MUF-affiliated thinktank was launched to produce its own research on urban planning, architecture, economics, and strategic urban planning.

categories.name: Moscow Medical Cluster
content: The Moscow International Medical Cluster (MMC) is the largest medical infrastructure project in Russia aimed at developing the national healthcare ecosystem. The cluster, which will include foreign clinics, research centers, and medical universities, opened in the fall of 2018 on the territory of the Skolkovo Innovation Center. Thanks to the cluster’s special legal status, its residents will be able to provide treatment and therapy to Russians according to international standards, using state-of-the-art technologies and equipment.

Technology and knowledge transfer is another mission of the cluster. The work of its residents will help Russian medical practitioners get acquainted with the best achievements of healthcare and subsequently use the new knowledge for the benefit of Russia.
Cluster development goals:
Opportunity to be treated in world-famous clinics without leaving Russia
A quantum leap in the qualifications of Russian physicians through educational programs and networking with foreign colleagues
A base for international R&D and testing of new drugs, technologies and equipment.

Hadassah Clinic, an Israel-based medical facility, is already operating on the territory of the cluster, with a fully functioning diagnostic center and a therapeutic building. The clinic has successfully implemented a multidisciplinary approach, and patients can receive the full range of medical care they need. A third building of the clinic, the Chronic Disease Center, is under construction. Its specialists will focus on palliative care and long-term care for elderly citizens. In addition, there is a simulation center in the cluster where Moscow-based doctors and nurses can practice their practical skills using modern robot simulators.

In 2023, a medical mall with several foreign clinics working in different specialties is scheduled to be opened. The specialties include orthopedics, pediatrics, women’s health, oncology, etc. In a decade years, more than ten leading clinics from OECD countries are expected to have their offices or outposts in Skolkovo.

The location of the medical cluster promotes partnership with the innovation center, which already has an information, a physical and a biomedical clusters. The MMC cooperates with Skolkovo residents in innovative projects, creating a comfortable environment for R&D. In particular, one of the main innovative programs of the educational center of the cluster includes advanced training for doctors on 48 simulators designed by Skolkovo residents. Above all, these are instruments for minimally invasive surgery on all parts of the body and for precise diagnostics, such as endoscopes.

The International Medical Cluster creates a natural environment favorable to human senses: sight, hearing, smell. The first phase of improvement opened in August 2021. It includes the Forest and Stream park, a solitary corner for communing with nature, and the Oval Square space, a place for socialization, for meetings of patients and their relatives, as well as active events.

The Moscow International Cluster actively develops cooperation with foreign partners. For instance, the MIC Foundation signed a cooperation agreement with the Turkish medical cluster OSTIM. Its mission is to foster Russian-Turkish relations in the field of construction, education, medicine and science. Plans include networking, experience and technology sharing, development of joint educational programs.

categories.name: RussPass Tourist Service
content: RussPass is an online service for planning travel in Russia. It allows users to book a hotel room, buy plane, train or bus tickets, and pay for museum admission. The service offers tours, excursions, and travel itineraries around Russian cities and towns. Users can pick a ready-made program or create a customized travel plan that includes selected locations. In total, RussPass offers 27 services.

RussPass has travel operators, hotels, tour guides, restaurants, museums and other organizations among its partners. They can promote their products and attract new customers by placing their offers on the platform.
Currently, RussPass supports four languages: Russian, English Spanish and Arabic. It is available as a web service and as a mobile app for different mobile platforms
Launch date: July 2020
By January 2021, service had been used by 700,000+ people
In January 2022, over 1,000 companies from 85 regions of Russia became the partners of the service
More than 5,500 tourist offers for traveling around Russia are available via RussPass

awards: RussPass won the Runet Award in the “Domestic Tourism Development” category
